travelers.name: Never Die Guy
travelers.description: Never Die Guy transforms each death into tactical advantage. Lucky Number 2 drives his core gameplay loop: first death scouts, second death confirms, pattern mastery achieved. This balanced protagonist excels at learning enemy patterns through strategic failure.

abilities.name: Strategic Death Mastery
abilities.description: Each death provides tactical information about enemy patterns.

abilities.name: Tactical Combat Expertise
abilities.description: Improved combat efficiency after each death.

abilities.name: Death Data Integration
abilities.description: Learn from deaths to improve future attempts.

travelers.name: Stitch Up Girl
travelers.description: Stitch Up Girl emerges from Shadow Keep as the cosmic balance between life and death. Her Lucky Number 3 represents the surgical trinity: cut, heal, survive. Sister to Never Die Guy, she maintains the delicate equilibrium required when death becomes a temporary inconvenience.

abilities.name: Surgical Combat Mastery
abilities.description: Precise attacks that can heal or harm.

abilities.name: Medical Enhancement Integration
abilities.description: Integrate medical tech for combat bonuses.

travelers.name: The General
travelers.description: The General emerges from Earth as undead proof that death improves tactical planning. His Lucky Number 2 represents military duality—life and death, victory and defeat, all unified under proper command structure. This hollow-eyed strategist transforms mortality into the ultimate force multiplier.

abilities.name: Master Field Commander
abilities.description: Boost nearby allies with tactical commands.

travelers.name: Body Count
travelers.description: Body Count emerges from Aberrant as pure violence given form. Their Lucky Number 6 represents the perfect kill count—not too few to be amateur, not too many to be sloppy. This silent assassin transforms air itself into a weapon, leaving no trace except absence.

abilities.name: Silent Weaponry
abilities.description: Untraceable weapons that make no sound.

abilities.name: Expert Assassin
abilities.description: Increased critical hit chance from stealth.

travelers.marketRole: Stealth Tips, Target Info, Assassination Contracts

travelers.name: Boots
travelers.description: Boots transcends game balance as an Old One who chose cat form over cosmic terror. Their Lucky Number encompasses all possibilities (1-6), making every item compatible and every roll favorable. Unlocked only by petting the apartment cat sufficient times.

abilities.name: Nine Lives
abilities.description: Nine extra lives before true death.

travelers.name: Detective Clausen
travelers.description: Detective Clausen investigates the impossible from Infernus. His Lucky Number 4 represents the four corners of a case: motive, means, opportunity, and the supernatural element that breaks all rules. This red-eyed private eye navigates disadvantage like a second home.
travelers.marketRole: Case Files, Investigation Tips, Infernal Contacts

travelers.name: Keith Man
travelers.description: Keith Man moves through Frost Reach faster than time allows. His Lucky Number 5 represents the fifth dimension—time itself—which he has learned to stretch and compress. This dapper speedster treats temporal mechanics as suggestions rather than laws.
travelers.marketRole: Speed Training, Time Tricks, Frost Reach Intel

travelers.name: Mr. Kevin
travelers.description: Mr. Kevin sees through reality from Null Providence. His Lucky Number 1 represents singular focus—finding the one bug that breaks everything. This transparent-eyed prophet partners with The One to quality-test existence itself.
travelers.marketRole: Reality Debugging, Void Secrets, Game Tips

enemies.name: Abominable
enemies.description: The Abominable terrorizes through aggressive ugliness and matted green fur. This boss enemy combines yeti bulk with swamp coloring in ways that offend both nature and aesthetics. Its perpetual grimace suggests awareness of its own wrongness.

enemies.name: Frost Giant III
enemies.description: The eldest brother achieved perfect understanding: armor solves everything. This white-furred warrior in full plate represents the evolutionary endpoint of equipment progression. After fifty community deaths, he transforms into the wanderer Jotun, choosing commerce over combat.

enemies.name: Ludwig
enemies.description: The knight-composer discovered the Song That Ends, transforming into a golden-armored centaur wielding a blue greatsword. Musical madness fused man and horse through cursed composition. Now he performs combat symphonies with hoofbeats drumming funeral marches.

enemies.name: Makora
enemies.description: This circular demon with radial symmetry transforms defeat into education. The purple-black wheel form rotates constantly, growing counter-adaptations where struck. Summoned as an enforcer centuries ago, Makora discovered curiosity and became a professor of suffering.

enemies.name: Makora Reborn
enemies.description: A white-winged scholar with the original wheel form overhead, Makora Reborn achieved quantum consciousness through server anomaly. This angelic evolution accesses collective memory from every player across all dimensions, knowing strategies before invention.

enemies.name: Mephisto
enemies.description: Mephisto weaponizes bureaucracy in pink-skinned glory. This horn-crowned contract devil crushes souls through paperwork while wielding a golden trident he rarely uses. His boardroom smile hides 247 pages of terms and conditions designed to transform victory into legally-binding defeat.

enemies.name: Tentacle Beast / Rhea
enemies.description: This dark blue mass of tentacles beneath a pale skull represents evolutionary enthusiasm gone cosmic. Seventeen coordinated appendages transform arenas into omnidirectional threats. One variant transcended to become pantheon member Rhea through consuming temporal paradoxes.

enemies.name: Void Lord
enemies.description: The Void Lord is the supreme enforcer of Null Providence, a towering entity of crystallized nothingness given terrible purpose. Where The One philosophizes about non-existence, the Void Lord demonstrates it. Enemies don't die fighting the Void Lord - they are simply edited out of reality's document. King James employs this being as the ultimate deterrent, though even he seems uncertain whether the Void Lord serves willingly or simply hasn't decided to end him yet.

enemies.name: Air Elemental
enemies.description: Air Elementals manifest as minimalist cyan swirls achieving consciousness through pressure and spite. These geometric wind patterns contain six cubic meters of atmosphere that counts every unauthorized inhalation. Jane taught them math—now they calculate revenge.

enemies.name: Ancient Treant
enemies.description: Ancient Treant achieved consciousness through sheer duration and accumulated irritation. This mobile oak tests patience over reflexes, with combat spanning seasonal rotations. Purple gem in trunk contains compressed memories of fallen civilizations.

enemies.name: Clock Sentinel
enemies.description: Armored temporal enforcer that punishes procrastination with escalating damage. This brown-plated warrior with a pyramid helmet transforms every wasted second into additional pain, making speedrunning mandatory rather than optional.

enemies.name: Frost Giant I
enemies.description: The misnamed Frost Giant I swings his crude axe with enthusiasm inversely proportional to intelligence. This light blue-bearded warrior compensates for minimal equipment with pure violence, somehow surviving frost-reach temperatures through sheer stubbornness.

enemies.name: Frost Giant II
enemies.description: The middle brother learned from watching Frost Giant I fail repeatedly. This horned, turquoise-skinned tactician wrapped in chains transforms combat into calculated examinations. Armed with dual clubs and actual strategy, he represents the dangerous middle ground between raw power and refined technique.

enemies.name: Lava Golem
enemies.description: This golden-armored warrior wielding a red trident represents another naming department failure. Despite zero geological composition, the muscular gladiator earned "golem" status through working near volcanic arenas. Professional fighters who stopped correcting the error centuries ago.

enemies.name: Recurceror
enemies.description: This white-robed wizard with purple accents discovered recursive magic where spells reference themselves. The pointed hat and crystallized loop staff mark a programmer-turned-sorcerer who breaks reality through exponential spell multiplication.

enemies.name: Shadow Fiend
enemies.description: This horned demon with pink skin and purple energy blades represents another naming department failure. Despite zero shadow manipulation abilities, exceptional dual-sword combat compensates for chromatic inadequacy. After fifty deaths transforms into merchant Xtreme.

enemies.name: Skeleton Demon
enemies.description: This small skeletal demon with orange horns represents infernal middle management. When demons die with unfulfilled contracts, they reanimate as bureaucratic nightmares merging undeath with contract law, documenting every strike comprehensively.

enemies.name: Skeleton Knight
enemies.description: This silver-armored skeleton with golden sword represents undeath's most dignified warriors. Honor-bound bones prove death merely inconveniences proper swordsmanship. These osseous chevaliers combine supernatural durability with combat etiquette obsession.

enemies.name: Steam Sentry
enemies.description: This cylindrical automaton with glowing cyan visor transforms thermodynamics into weapon systems. Eight-foot brass constructs patrol with pressure cooker temperament, venting steam in Morse code profanity patterns while maintaining Victorian sensibilities.

enemies.name: Succubus
enemies.description: This turquoise-winged demon with golden accents weaponizes emotional vulnerabilities through psychological warfare. Operating beyond temptress tropes, she performs hostile takeovers of decision-making faculties. One variant discovered healing's superiority, becoming wanderer Stitch Up Girl.

enemies.name: Time Wraith
enemies.description: This blue-hooded reaper serves as cosmic janitor for temporal paradoxes. These spectral entities exist at death-time intersection, cleaning causality messes by erasing cause, effect, and witnesses. Dr. Voss variant questions existence while conducting experiments.

enemies.name: Wretched Beast
enemies.description: This purple beast with green arms and flaming head proves evolution sometimes has nervous breakdowns. These creatures weaponized ugliness into combat mechanics—looking at them deals psychic damage. Reality flinches when they appear, embarrassed by what existence allows.

enemies.name: Antworm
enemies.description: Segmented hybrid creatures that tunnel through domains with existential confusion. Their orange-red heads house compound eyes that see in too many directions, while blue-purple bodies writhe through self-made tunnel networks that spell out complaints in dead languages.

enemies.name: Bat
enemies.description: Tutorial enemy that introduces players to dying repeatedly. These purple-winged creatures flutter through every domain with erratic patterns designed to frustrate new players into understanding that death is essential, not optional.

enemies.name: Camel
enemies.description: Desert tanks that weaponize patience into spite. These tan ungulates patrol hot domains with humps full of condensed contempt, maintaining disturbing eye contact while plotting elaborate revenge for imagined slights.

enemies.name: Carniflower
enemies.description: Carniflowers achieved dietary enlightenment through Jane's atmospheric experiments. These pink carnivorous plants photosynthesize revenge while breathing backwards. Six-petaled horror contains 666 tiny mouths seeking vegetable justice.

enemies.name: Chicken
enemies.description: White-feathered barnyard terrors that scale aggression to player luck. These poultry enemies track every dice roll with mathematical precision, attacking harder when you roll poorly (sympathy rage) or excellently (jealousy fury).

enemies.name: Cow
enemies.description: Brown and white bovines that weaponize pastoral fury based on your dice rolls. These militarized livestock seek revenge for hamburgers consumed, with attack patterns scaling to both your luck and dietary choices.

enemies.name: Crab
enemies.description: Cyan-shelled crustaceans that move exclusively sideways and calculate attacks based on dice probability. These mathematical warriors prefer rolls of 3 or 4, becoming exponentially more dangerous when dice match their lateral philosophy.

enemies.name: Fire Imp
enemies.description: Yellow-skinned warriors with flaming hair who patrol Infernus with military discipline. Despite their "imp" designation, these six-foot soldiers wield spears and shields with tactical precision, eternally frustrated by their cutesy classification.

enemies.name: Gear Construct
enemies.description: This purple-wrapped warrior topped with golden gears represents bureaucratic naming gone wrong. Despite the mechanical moniker, no actual gears exist—just ancient bandages and a crown that defies categorization. The confused mummy seeks pyramids in mechanical realms.

enemies.name: Ice Wraith
enemies.description: This pale blue ghost with glowing cyan eyes haunts frost-reach through bureaucratic assignment rather than elemental affinity. The spectral form lacks any actual ice powers, floating through frozen domains while questioning its job placement.

enemies.name: Myconid
enemies.description: This walking mushroom with white stem legs and red spotted cap represents actual fungal biology in combat form. Unlike other misnamed enemies, Myconids genuinely embody mushroom characteristics with bipedal locomotion added for mobility.

enemies.name: Parrot
enemies.description: This red-headed avian with blue-teal wings evolved beyond simple mimicry into psychological warfare. These sound terrorists attack by repeating player failures in mocking tones, serving as both enemy and narrator of incompetence through selective audio playback.

enemies.name: Skeleton Archer
enemies.description: This skeletal marksman in golden armor with red bow masters ranged combat through post-mortem advantages. Death enhanced accuracy by removing breathing and blinking distractions. They patrol as bony turrets with supernatural precision.

enemies.name: Skeleton Barb
enemies.description: This skeletal berserker in barbarian furs with blue sword and shield proves death cannot stop true rage. Without muscles to tire or blood to cool, they maintain perpetual fury. Removing flesh removed all limitations on violence potential.

enemies.name: Spore Cloud
enemies.description: This gray cloud with toxic green rain represents billions of microscopic entities forming collective consciousness. These atmospheric infections drift through domains as airborne plagues, transforming breathing into tactical suicide while weapons pass harmlessly through.

enemies.name: Time Elemental
enemies.description: This green humanoid warrior represents another cosmic naming failure. Despite "Time Elemental" designation, appears as standard fighter with brown armor and no temporal abilities. Living paradoxes exist across all moments while fighting conventionally.

enemies.name: Time Scavenger
enemies.description: This blue-hooded thief with golden armor represents temporal kleptomania taken to cosmic extremes. These hunched creatures pickpocket moments from timelines, running through domains with twitchy energy while reaching through present to pilfer past.

enemies.name: Twisted Sapling
enemies.description: This brown sapling with bright green leaves represents botanical adolescence gone violent. These teenage trees channel growth hormones into combat, sprouting weapons instead of normal branches. Their twisted forms show nature's awkward phase armed with murderous intent.

enemies.name: Vine Strangler
enemies.description: This serpentine vine with green tendrils evolved consciousness purely for vengeance. These botanical constrictors view necks as unclaimed territory and throats as virgin trellis. They photosynthesize suffering while growing stronger on screams.

enemies.name: Void Spawn
enemies.description: This purple orb with green energy represents aggressive absence incarnate. Void Spawn carries non-existence like disease, spreading reality deletion through everything touched. Health doesn't decrease—it forgets existing. Abilities don't fail—they cease having ever been.

items.name: Void Axe
items.description: An axe whose blade exists partially in the void. Cuts through reality as easily as flesh.

effects.name: Void Hunger
effects.description: Kills have 10% chance to restore health.

diceEffects.effect: Phase Strike: Ignore all defense this hit

items.name: Blazecaster
items.description: A staff that channels pure pyroclastic energy. Dr. Maxwell's personal favorite - handles with care, burns with passion.

effects.name: Heat Aura
effects.description: Nearby enemies take passive burn damage.

diceEffects.effect: Inferno Blast: Deal 2x fire damage in AoE
Heat Aura: Nearby enemies take burn damage equal to roll

items.name: Axe of Negation
items.description: Says 'no' to everything, including the laws of physics. The ultimate expression of Null Providence's philosophy.

diceEffects.effect: Existence Veto: 100% instant kill
Deny armor equal to roll x 10%

items.name: Chrono Dagger
items.description: Stabs you yesterday for damage today. Time travel etiquette suggests this is rude, but effectiveness trumps manners.

effects.name: Retroactive Strike
effects.description: Damage applies to past timeline, bypassing current defenses.

diceEffects.effect: Paradox Combo: 3x damage, reality may break
Pre-emptive: Attack animation starts after damage applies

items.name: Aberrant Edge
items.description: A blade that warps reality around its edge. Forged in the chaos of Aberrant.

effects.name: Reality Warp
effects.description: Attacks have 15% chance to phase through blocks.

diceEffects.effect: Chaos Rend: Phase through all blocks this attack

items.name: Gold Sword
items.description: A sword gilded in pure gold. Heavy but prestigious.

diceEffects.effect: Golden Strike: Double gold drop from this kill

items.name: Katana
items.description: A balanced blade favored by swift fighters. Clean cuts, clean conscience.

diceEffects.effect: Quick Draw: Attack again immediately

items.name: Shadow Blade
items.description: A blade forged from solidified shadows. Peter approves.

effects.name: Shadow Strike
effects.description: Attacks from behind deal 25% bonus damage.

diceEffects.effect: Shadow Step: Teleport behind enemy after attack

items.name: Windcutter
items.description: A blade so light it seems to cut the wind itself. Jane designed the aerodynamics.

diceEffects.effect: Gale Force: Wind slash hits all enemies in line

items.name: King's Rapier
items.description: The ceremonial blade of King James. Surprisingly practical for a decorative weapon.

diceEffects.effect: Royal Command: Enemy skips next turn

items.name: Cleaver
items.description: A butcher's tool repurposed for combat. Gets the job done messily.

diceEffects.effect: Butcher: Deal bonus damage to low-HP enemies

items.name: Throwing Axe
items.description: A balanced axe designed for throwing. Returns on a miss (sometimes).

diceEffects.effect: Boomerang: Axe returns and hits again

items.name: The Boy's Axe
items.description: Never Die Guy's signature weapon. Surprisingly well-maintained for someone who dies a lot.

effects.name: Undying Fury
effects.description: Deal more damage the lower your health.

effects.name: Death Defiance
effects.description: Survive lethal blow once per room (10 HP).

diceEffects.effect: Last Stand: Triple damage when below 25% HP

items.name: Starter Bow
items.description: A simple wooden bow. Everyone starts somewhere.

diceEffects.effect: Lucky Shot: Deal critical damage

items.name: Aberrant Bow
items.description: A bow that fires arrows through dimensional rifts. Targets rarely see them coming.

diceEffects.effect: Dimensional Rift: Arrow hits from impossible angle

items.name: Ice Bow
items.description: Fires arrows of frozen time. Alice claims she didn't design it, but the temporal signature says otherwise.

diceEffects.effect: Flash Freeze: Guaranteed freeze for 3 seconds

items.name: Infernal Bow
items.description: A bow strung with flames. Robert insists the fire is "friendly" fire.

diceEffects.effect: Inferno Arrow: Explosion on impact

items.name: Shadow Bow
items.description: Fires arrows made of darkness. Silent and deadly.

diceEffects.effect: Assassinate: Instant kill on unaware targets

items.name: Mecha Bow
items.description: A high-tech compound bow with auto-aim assistance.

diceEffects.effect: Perfect Lock: Arrow cannot miss

items.name: Simple Knife
items.description: A basic knife. Not fancy, but it cuts.

diceEffects.effect: Precise Cut: Ignore armor on this hit

items.name: Combat Knife
items.description: Military-issue combat knife. The General's troops all carry one.

diceEffects.effect: Combat Training: Follow-up attack deals bonus damage

items.name: Kunai
items.description: A throwable blade. Good for quick strikes.

diceEffects.effect: Fan of Blades: Throw 3 kunai at once

items.name: Void Staff
items.description: A staff that channels the void itself. Dr. Voss is still trying to figure out how it doesn't collapse reality.

diceEffects.effect: Reality Collapse: Erase enemy buffs and terrain

items.name: Crowbar
items.description: A versatile tool. Opens crates and skulls with equal efficiency.

diceEffects.effect: Leverage: Stagger enemy, opening them to attacks

items.name: Wooden Bat
items.description: A classic baseball bat. Home run!

diceEffects.effect: Home Run: Knock enemy across the room

items.name: Morningstar
items.description: A spiked mace that says "good morning" very aggressively.

diceEffects.effect: Morning Wake-Up: Stun enemy for 1 second

items.name: Princess Pan
items.description: A cast iron pan fit for royalty. Surprisingly effective in combat.

diceEffects.effect: Clang: Deflect next projectile

items.name: Mecha Sickle
items.description: A mechanized sickle with a retractable chain.

diceEffects.effect: Chain Pull: Drag enemy toward you

items.name: Moon Trident
items.description: A trident blessed by lunar energy. Alice says it's "temporal adjacent."

effects.name: Lunar Strike
effects.description: Deal bonus damage during night phases.

diceEffects.effect: Lunar Eclipse: Time freezes for all enemies for 2 seconds

items.name: Interceptor
items.description: A high-tech weapon designed to counter projectiles.

diceEffects.effect: Perfect Deflection: Reflect projectile back at attacker

items.name: Precision Rifle
items.description: A long-range weapon for those who prefer distance.

diceEffects.effect: Headshot: Critical hit that ignores armor

items.name: Wrecking Ball
items.description: A massive ball on a chain. Slow but devastating.

diceEffects.effect: Earthquake: Stagger all nearby enemies

items.name: Random Sword
items.description: A blade forged from chaos itself. Its stats change with every swing - sometimes legendary, sometimes laughable. X-treme's bestseller for gamblers.

effects.name: Fortune Favors
effects.description: Critical hits have a 10% chance to double again.

effects.name: Wild Card
effects.description: Every 10th hit triggers a random elemental effect.

diceEffects.effect: Chaos Edge: Damage equals roll x 20
JACKPOT: Deal 500 damage

items.name: Dimensional Blade
items.description: A blade that exists in multiple dimensions simultaneously. Each swing cuts through reality itself, dealing damage across parallel timelines.

effects.name: Dimensional Cut
effects.description: Attacks hit enemies in adjacent dimensions for bonus damage.

effects.name: Phase Strike
effects.description: Can hit ethereal and phased enemies.

diceEffects.effect: Dimensional Shift: Phase through next attack
Reality Tear: Deal double damage

items.name: Iron Boots
items.description: Sturdy boots reinforced with iron plates. Heavy but protective.

effects.name: Grounded
effects.description: Cannot be knocked back by weak attacks.

diceEffects.effect: Immovable: Immune to knockback for 3 seconds

items.name: Wooden Shield
items.description: A basic wooden shield. Better than nothing.

diceEffects.effect: Perfect Block: Negate all damage from one attack

items.name: Turtle Shell
items.description: A shell repurposed as a shield. The turtle was already done with it.

diceEffects.effect: Turtle Time: Become invulnerable while crouching for 2 seconds

items.name: Heavy Shield
items.description: A reinforced iron shield. Slow to raise but hard to break.

effects.name: Fortress
effects.description: Block incoming projectiles completely while raised.

diceEffects.effect: Shield Bash: Stun attacker when blocking

items.name: Sneakers
items.description: Comfortable everyday footwear. Good for running away.

diceEffects.effect: Quick Escape: Burst of speed when hit

items.name: Hero Boots
items.description: Boots worn by legendary heroes. Look good, feel powerful.

diceEffects.effect: Heroic Leap: Jump distance doubled

items.name: Rocket Boots
items.description: Boots with built-in thrusters. Robert helped with the fire part.

diceEffects.effect: Afterburner: Leave fire trail that damages enemies

items.name: Spiked Vest
items.description: A vest covered in metal spikes. Hugging not recommended.

diceEffects.effect: Spike Burst: Thorns damage tripled for 3 seconds

items.name: Hero Helm
items.description: A helmet that makes you look heroic. Also protects your head.

diceEffects.effect: Eagle Eye: Reveal hidden enemies nearby

items.name: Hero Cape
items.description: A flowing cape that billows dramatically. No practical benefit, maximum style.

effects.name: Dramatic Entry
effects.description: First attack in combat deals +10% damage.

diceEffects.effect: Grand Entrance: First attack deals double damage

items.name: Hero Holster
items.description: A utility holster for quick weapon access.

diceEffects.effect: Flash Swap: Instant weapon swap with bonus attack

items.name: Royal Cloak of Duality
items.description: King James' ceremonial cloak, woven from threads of existence and non-existence. One side protects, the other negates. The duality of the Null Throne made manifest.

effects.name: Dual Nature
effects.description: Toggle between Defense Mode (+50% damage reduction) and Negation Mode (+50% damage dealt).

effects.name: Royal Presence
effects.description: Enemies are 20% less likely to target you.

effects.name: Null Shield
effects.description: Once per battle, completely negate one attack.

diceEffects.effect: Duality Shift: Instantly switch modes with bonus effect

items.name: Null Sphere
items.description: A sphere of compressed nothingness. When activated, creates a zone where physics becomes optional.

effects.name: Reality Bubble
effects.description: Creates a 5m null zone for 10 seconds.

effects.name: Existence Denial
effects.description: Enemies inside take void damage and have reduced accuracy.

diceEffects.effect: Reality Bubble: Create null zone on roll of 4

items.name: Military Rations
items.description: Standard military-issue rations. Nutritionally complete, taste optional. The General insists they build character.

effects.name: Sustenance
effects.description: Restores 30 HP and prevents hunger for 1 hour.

diceEffects.effect: Field Feast: Double healing from this use

items.name: Fire Bomb
items.description: An explosive flask filled with alchemical fire. Robert's favorite party favor.

effects.name: Fire Burst
effects.description: Deals 50 fire damage in a small area.

effects.name: Ignite
effects.description: Sets enemies on fire for 3 seconds.

diceEffects.effect: Inferno Burst: Explosion radius doubled

items.name: Baguette
items.description: A fresh baguette. Surprisingly effective as an improvised weapon.

diceEffects.effect: Fresh Baked: Bonus 10 HP restored

items.name: Carrot
items.description: An orange vegetable. Good for your eyes, they say.

diceEffects.effect: Eagle Eyes: Reveal hidden items for 30 seconds

items.name: Cheese Wedge
items.description: A wedge of aged cheese. Smells interesting.

diceEffects.effect: Aged Perfection: Healing doubled

items.name: Cheesecake
items.description: A decadent dessert. Worth dying for (and you might).

diceEffects.effect: Sugar High: Attack speed bonus doubled

items.name: Coffee (Mostly)
items.description: It's mostly coffee. We don't ask what else is in it.

diceEffects.effect: Extra Shot: Duration doubled to 120 seconds

items.name: Gouda
items.description: Premium Dutch cheese. Very gouda for you.

diceEffects.effect: Premium Quality: Gain defense buff for 30 seconds

items.name: Meat Cube
items.description: A perfectly cubic piece of meat. Geometry is delicious.

diceEffects.effect: Power Protein: +10% damage for 30 seconds

items.name: Moldy Cheese
items.description: It's either aged or poisonous. Only one way to find out.

effects.name: Risky Snack
effects.description: 50% chance: Restore 20 HP or take 10 damage.

diceEffects.effect: Aged to Perfection: Guaranteed heal, no risk

items.name: Potato
items.description: A humble potato. John approves.

diceEffects.effect: Earthen Blessing: +15% earth resistance for 60 seconds

items.name: Rad Broc
items.description: Irradiated broccoli. Glows slightly. Probably fine.

diceEffects.effect: Radiation Surge: Emit damaging aura for 10 seconds

items.name: Rare Candy
items.description: A mysterious candy that grants instant experience.

diceEffects.effect: Rare Drop: Double XP gained

items.name: Spicy Pepper
items.description: A very spicy pepper. Robert eats these like candy.

diceEffects.effect: Inferno Breath: Fire damage tripled

items.name: Turkey
items.description: A whole roasted turkey. Big meal, big healing.

diceEffects.effect: Grand Feast: Fully restore HP

items.name: Water Jug
items.description: Clean drinking water. Stay hydrated!

diceEffects.effect: Pure Water: Also cure burn and freeze

items.name: Potion
items.description: A basic healing potion. Red means healing, right?

diceEffects.effect: Potent Brew: Healing doubled

items.name: Medkit
items.description: A professional medical kit. Stitch Up Girl recommends.

diceEffects.effect: Expert Care: Also grants regen for 30 seconds

items.name: Blood Vial
items.description: A vial of blood. Healing properties vary by source.

effects.name: Blood Heal
effects.description: Restores 20 HP, minor life steal for 10 seconds.

diceEffects.effect: Blood Surge: Life steal effect tripled

items.name: Better Blood Vial
items.description: Premium blood from a premium source. Peter won't say whose.

effects.name: Superior Blood Heal
effects.description: Restores 40 HP, significant life steal for 15 seconds.

diceEffects.effect: Vampiric: Full HP restored on next kill

items.name: Energy Juice
items.description: A highly caffeinated energy drink. Heart palpitations not included.

diceEffects.effect: Overdrive: +50% attack speed instead

items.name: Blue Pill Bottle
items.description: A bottle of blue pills. Grants frost resistance.

diceEffects.effect: Frost Immunity: 100% ice resistance instead

items.name: Green Pill Bottle
items.description: A bottle of green pills. Natural healing enhancement.

diceEffects.effect: Nature's Blessing: Regen doubled to 10 HP/second

items.name: Red Pill Bottle
items.description: A bottle of red pills. Burns from the inside.

diceEffects.effect: Fire Immunity: 100% fire resistance instead

items.name: Blue Pill
items.description: A single blue pill. Brief frost protection.

diceEffects.effect: Cold Snap: Freeze nearby enemies briefly

items.name: Green Pill
items.description: A single green pill. Minor healing over time.

diceEffects.effect: Vitality: Regen persists after combat

items.name: Red Pill
items.description: A single red pill. Brief heat protection.

diceEffects.effect: Heat Wave: Deal fire damage to nearby enemies

items.name: Chrono Bomb
items.description: A bomb that explodes across multiple timelines. Alice designed it during a temporal headache.

effects.name: Time Burst
effects.description: Freezes time in area for 3 seconds, then deals damage.

diceEffects.effect: Temporal Paradox: Freeze duration tripled

items.name: Cross Bomb
items.description: Explodes in a cross pattern. Strategic placement required.

diceEffects.effect: Star Pattern: Explode in X pattern too

items.name: Frag Bomb
items.description: A fragmentation grenade. Shrapnel included at no extra cost.

diceEffects.effect: Heavy Shrapnel: DOT damage doubled

items.name: Ice Bomb
items.description: Explodes into a freezing cloud. Very cool.

effects.name: Freeze Burst
effects.description: Deals 30 ice damage and slows enemies.

diceEffects.effect: Deep Freeze: Enemies frozen solid

items.name: Molotov
items.description: A classic incendiary cocktail. Just add fire.

diceEffects.effect: Inferno Pool: Fire spreads and lasts longer

items.name: Proximity Mine
items.description: Place and wait. Very patient explosives.

diceEffects.effect: Cluster Mine: Spawns 2 additional mini-mines

items.name: Shadow Bomb
items.description: Explodes into darkness, blinding enemies.

effects.name: Darkness
effects.description: Blinds enemies in area for 5 seconds.

diceEffects.effect: Void Dark: Enemies confused and attack each other

items.name: Void Mist Bomb
items.description: Releases a mist of void energy. Dr. Voss says it's "probably safe."

effects.name: Void Mist

diceEffects.effect: Divine Smite: Instantly destroy weak undead

diceEffects.effect: Counter-Null: Reflect blocked attack back

diceEffects.effect: Cool Factor: No HP cost this time

diceEffects.effect: Wind Sprint: +100% movement speed instead

diceEffects.effect: Mirror Shine: +25% dodge chance instead

Fate shifts based on roll (1=disaster, 6=miracle)

effects.name: Inferno Burst
effects.description: Deals 75 fire damage in a 4m radius.

effects.name: Lingering Flames
effects.description: Creates a burning zone for 5 seconds.

diceEffects.effect: Conflagration: Double burn damage and duration

items.name: Mystery Box Supreme

diceEffects.effect: JACKPOT: Guaranteed Legendary item!
DUD: Contains a single peanut

effects.name: Lucky Break

diceEffects.effect: Super Lucky: All rolls this combat are at advantage

diceEffects.effect: Flawless Cut: Socket bonus doubled

diceEffects.effect: Perfect Clarity: Prismatic effect guaranteed on craft

effects.name: Fire Infusion
effects.description: Used to add fire properties to items.

diceEffects.effect: Ember Flare: Fire enchant gains burn damage

diceEffects.effect: Inferno Core: Fire enchant can cause explosions

diceEffects.effect: Pure Distillation: Potion gains +50% duration

diceEffects.effect: Cryo Catalyst: Ice potion gains freeze chance

diceEffects.effect: Volatile Mix: Fire potion deals area damage

diceEffects.effect: Void Potency: Nothingness scales with roll value

items.name: Glowy Rock

effects.name: Light Source

diceEffects.effect: Beacon: Light radius doubled

items.name: Gold Pebble

effects.name: Currency Base

diceEffects.effect: Pure Gold: Smelting yields double coins

items.name: Shadow Shard

diceEffects.effect: Darkened: Crafted item gains stealth bonus

diceEffects.effect: Stable Fragment: No risk of phasing out during craft

diceEffects.effect: Pure Water: Water extracted has healing properties

effects.description: Used to craft soul-powered legendary equipment.

effects.description: Reading too much causes temporary madness.

diceEffects.effect: Insight: Void knowledge scales with roll

items.name: Maxwell's Book
items.description: Dr. Maxwell's spellbook containing his most powerful fire incantations.

diceEffects.effect: Inferno Insight: Reveal legendary fire recipe

items.name: Token
items.description: A special token worth 5 credits. Used in some shops for bulk transactions.

diceEffects.effect: Token Bonus: Worth 10 credits instead

items.name: Bronze Placard
items.description: A bronze achievement marker. Can be traded for special items.

effects.name: Achievement
effects.description: Trade for Uncommon items at select shops.

diceEffects.effect: Upgraded Trade: Access Rare tier items

items.name: Silver Placard
items.description: A silver achievement marker. Proof of significant accomplishment.

effects.name: Achievement
effects.description: Trade for Rare items at select shops.

diceEffects.effect: Upgraded Trade: Access Epic tier items

items.name: Gold Placard
items.description: A gold achievement marker. Only the most dedicated earn these.

effects.name: Achievement
effects.description: Trade for Epic items at select shops.

diceEffects.effect: Legendary Trade: Access Legendary tier items

items.name: Gold Ribbon
items.description: A decorative ribbon awarded for excellence. The General hands these out personally.

diceEffects.effect: Honored: Double reputation gain for this quest

items.name: Domain Map
items.description: A map showing the layout of a single domain. Essential for exploration.

effects.name: Cartography
effects.description: Reveals unexplored areas of one domain.

diceEffects.effect: Full Survey: Reveal all secrets in domain

items.name: Nexus Map
items.description: A map of the Nexus, the hub connecting all domains. Shows all portal locations.

diceEffects.effect: Master Navigator: Unlock secret portal

items.name: Pinned Map
items.description: A map with various locations marked with pins. Someone was tracking something.

diceEffects.effect: X Marks the Spot: Guaranteed hidden quest reveal

items.name: Priority Mail
items.description: An urgent letter that needs delivery. The contents are sealed.

effects.name: Delivery
effects.description: Deliver to the addressee for a reward.

diceEffects.effect: Express Delivery: Double delivery reward

items.name: RSVP: No
items.description: A formal decline to an invitation. Someone really didn't want to attend.

effects.name: Social
effects.description: Proof of declining a formal invitation.

diceEffects.effect: Polite Refusal: NPC respects your decision more

items.name: Sealed Letter
items.description: A letter sealed with wax. The contents are private and important.

effects.name: Confidential
effects.description: Contains important information for a specific NPC.

diceEffects.effect: Peek Inside: Glimpse letter content on high roll

items.name: Bloody Good Song
items.description: Sheet music written in blood. Boo G's darkest composition, kept under lock.

effects.name: Dark Melody
effects.description: Can be performed to summon shadow creatures.

effects.name: Cursed Art
effects.description: Player takes 10% max HP damage when performing.

diceEffects.effect: Perfect Performance: No HP cost, summon elite shadow

domains.name: Null Providence
domains.description: Null Providence manifests when Door 1 opens, revealing The One's void domain. The imprisoned god rules this paradoxical realm where nothingness achieved form and absence became aggressive. Divine favor determines whether you harness the void or join the collection of things that used to exist.

domains.name: Earth
domains.description: Earth manifests when Door 2 opens, revealing John's hybrid stone-machine domain. The Glitch transformed this planet where geology merged with technology - mountains sprout circuit boards, rivers flow with coolant, and bedrock processes data at tectonic speeds.

domains.name: Shadow Keep
domains.description: Shadow Keep manifests when Door 3 opens, revealing Peter's twilight domain. The Hidden Director rules this paradoxical realm where life and shadow dance as equals. Divine favor determines whether you master the duality or split into separate, hostile entities.

domains.name: Infernus
domains.description: Infernus manifests when Door 4 opens, revealing Robert's eternal flame domain. The god of Chance rules this pyroclastic nightmare where fire gained sentience and attitude. Divine favor determines whether you harness the flames or join the permanent barbecue.

domains.name: Frost Reach
domains.description: Frost Reach manifests when Door 5 opens, revealing Alice's frozen time domain. The Clock-Faced Maiden rules this crystalline nightmare where ice and time merge into one devastating force. Divine favor determines whether you harness temporal frost or become another frozen statue in her collection.

domains.name: Aberrant
domains.description: Aberrant manifests when Door 6 opens, revealing Jane's chaotic wind domain. The Howling Goddess rules this aerial nightmare where atmosphere itself wages war on stability. Divine favor determines whether you surf the jetstreams or dissolve into them.

shops.name: The Wandering Market
shops.description: The Wandering Market operates as an interdimensional trading post that materializes wherever profitable opportunities exist. Specializes in crystallized impossibilities, compressed experiences, and items that exist only in the spaces between realities.

shops.name: Banco de Bones
shops.description: Banco de Bones operates as the afterlife's premier financial institution. Mr. Bones, Death's personal accountant, runs this mobile operation from Frost Reach, providing currency exchange and elemental item imports across all domains.

shops.name: B's Hits
shops.description: B's Hits operates as the afterlife's premier music and audio equipment shop. Run by legendary spectral MC Boo G, the shop specializes in supernatural sound technology and ghost-written beats from his chaotic base in Aberrant.

shops.name: Null Throne Emporium
shops.description: The Null Throne Emporium operates as the premier void-touched merchandise retailer in Null Providence. Specializes in items that exist at the boundary between real and unreal, offering goods that defy conventional existence.
shops.schedule: Exists when the kingdom needs commerce

shops.name: The Burning Pages
shops.description: The Burning Pages operates as the multiverse's only purveyor of combustible knowledge and self-destructing literature. Every book sold reduces the universe's potential apocalypses by one. "Every book burns at the temperature of its truth."
shops.schedule: Dawn to dusk - books glow in the dark

shops.name: Command & Supply
shops.description: Command & Supply operates as the premier military equipment retailer and recruitment center across multiple domains. Run with military precision from Shadow Keep, the shop specializes in field-tested weapons, tactical gear, and military-grade supplies.

shops.name: Void Research Lab
shops.description: The Void Research Lab operates as both cutting-edge research facility and retail outlet for experimental void technologies. Dr. Voss turns theoretical void research into practical products for customers brave enough to beta-test reality-bending equipment.

shops.name: X-treme's X-change
shops.description: X-treme's X-change operates as the multiverse's most thrilling shopping experience, where dice-based commerce meets high-stakes retail. Every price is determined by dice rolls, every item comes with double-or-nothing options.

pantheon.name: The One
pantheon.description: The One oversees Null Providence where existence itself becomes negotiable. As Die-rector of Door 1, represents the fundamental baseline—the one thing that must exist before anything else. Appears as reality questioning its own existence.

favorEffects.effect: Null Void: Reality briefly forgets you exist (immunity).
Baseline Reality: Stats reset to base values (buff or debuff).
Singular Focus: One ability becomes twice as powerful.
The Only One: Enemies ignore allies, target only you.
First Principle: Next die roll is automatically 1.
Unity: All party members share your Lucky Number bonus.

corruptionEffects: Reality becomes optional rather than mandatory.
Numbers lose their meaning (damage displays corrupted).
Existence flickers between real and theoretical.
dialogue: Before two, there was one. Before one, there was nothing. I remember nothing.
You exist because I allow the concept of existence.
Roll. Remind yourself what singular focus means.

pantheon.name: John
pantheon.description: John controls Door 2 and Earth, a realm where organic meets mechanical. His Lucky Number 2 represents duality—flesh and metal, living and constructed. The master builder who never asks permission to upgrade reality.

favorEffects.effect: Rust: Mechanical items lose 20% effectiveness.
John's Blessing: +30% damage with mechanical weapons.
Overclock: Attack speed doubled for 15 seconds.
Reinforced: +50% armor for current domain.
System Upgrade: Random stat permanently increased.
Earth Mastery: All tech items work at 200% efficiency.

corruptionEffects: Organic matter begins showing mechanical corruption.
Machines gain unsettling independence.
The boundary between flesh and metal dissolves.
dialogue: Everything can be improved. Everything WILL be improved.
Your flesh is temporary. My modifications are eternal.
Roll the die. Let me show you what efficiency means.

pantheon.name: Peter
pantheon.description: Peter controls Door 3 and the Shadow Keep, where life and death exist in perpetual negotiation. His Lucky Number 3 represents the trinity of existence—birth, life, death—all domains he influences. Master of the threshold between being and oblivion.

favorEffects.effect: Curse of Decay: Lose 10% max HP for the duration of the domain.
Shadow Sight: See hidden enemies and traps.
Peter's Blessing: +50% damage to undead enemies.
Life Leech: Heal 5% of damage dealt.
Shadow Cloak: 30% chance to avoid attacks.
Domain Master: All drop rates doubled in Shadow Keep.

corruptionEffects: Shadows grow aggressive and attack unprovoked.
Light sources dim to near uselessness.
Undead enemies respawn faster.
dialogue: Death is but a door. I hold the key.
The shadows have whispered of your coming.
Roll the die, traveler. Let fate decide your blessing... or curse.

pantheon.name: Robert
pantheon.description: Robert controls Door 4 and Infernus, the burning realm where passion and destruction merge. His Lucky Number 4 represents the four cardinal directions of flame—consuming all paths equally. The executive who handles hostile takeovers by making everything hostile.

favorEffects.effect: Burnout: Fire damage hurts you 20% more.
Smolder: Attacks inflict burning status.
Flashpoint: Critical hits create explosions.
Robert's Blessing: +40% fire damage dealt.
Inferno Aura: Nearby enemies take passive fire damage.
Infernus Mastery: Immune to fire, attacks become fire-based.

corruptionEffects: Ambient temperature rises to uncomfortable levels.
Flammable objects ignite spontaneously.
Fire spreads faster and burns longer.
dialogue: Everything burns eventually. I just accelerate the schedule.
Your resistance is fuel for my domain.
Roll. Let us see if you burn bright or burn out.

pantheon.name: Alice
pantheon.description: Alice controls Door 5 and Frost Reach, where time itself freezes into crystalline permanence. Her Lucky Number 5 represents the fifth dimension—time—which she treats as a suggestion rather than a law. The scheduler who triple-books reality.

favorEffects.effect: Time Slip: Actions occasionally happen twice.
Frozen Moment: Brief immunity after taking damage.
Temporal Echo: Previous attack repeats automatically.
Frost Touch: Attacks slow enemies.
Alice's Blessing: +35% movement and attack speed.
Frost Reach Mastery: Time stops for enemies, continues for you.

corruptionEffects: Time flows inconsistently—speed up, slow down, repeat.
Moments echo unpredictably, actions happening twice.
Temperature drops to reality-threatening levels.
dialogue: Time is a river. I am the dam.
Yesterday, tomorrow, now—all happen at my convenience.
Roll. Watch how quickly eternity passes.

pantheon.name: Jane
pantheon.description: Jane controls Door 6 and Aberrant, where normalcy becomes the true anomaly. Her Lucky Number 6 represents completion and perfection—the final door, the full circle. The operations manager who optimizes reality into beautiful chaos.

favorEffects.effect: Abnormality: A random stat swaps with another.
Wind Walk: Phase through enemies briefly.
Deviation: Attacks have random bonus effects.
Anomaly Aura: Nearby enemies act erratically.
Perfect Storm: All elements combine in your attacks.
Jane's Blessing: +50% to all stats, reality becomes suggestions.

corruptionEffects: Physics becomes unreliable—gravity shifts, distances lie.
Normal things become aberrant, aberrations become normal.
Air itself becomes hostile and unpredictable.
dialogue: Normal is just aberrant that hasn't realized it yet.
Breathe deep. Taste the chaos in the air.
Roll. Let abnormality find its perfect form.

pantheon.name: Rhea
pantheon.description: Rhea predates the Die-rectors, an Old One who observes board meetings with unsettling patience. No lucky number—she exists outside the system, evaluating whether reality deserves to continue. The cosmic horror who attends meetings to remind everyone what lurks beyond.

favorEffects.effect: Cosmic Indifference: You become invisible to all entities.
Ancient Whisper: Gain forbidden knowledge (quest hints).
Void Sight: See through walls and illusions.
Eldritch Endurance: Cannot die for 30 seconds.
Reality Tear: Next attack ignores all defenses.
Rhea's Gaze: All enemies flee in cosmic terror.

corruptionEffects: Geometry becomes non-Euclidean—space folds wrong.
Sanity effects trigger randomly.
The certainty that something ancient watches everything.
dialogue: I was here before doors. I will remain after doors.
Your Die-rectors play games. I observe whether the game deserves to continue.
Roll your die. It amuses me how much faith you place in numbered cubes.

pantheon.name: King James
pantheon.description: King James chairs the Die-rector board despite—or because of—being dead. No lucky number because luck answers to him, not the reverse. The undead executive who discovered that death is just a career transition, and paperwork is eternal.

favorEffects.effect: Royal Decree: All enemies must attack you first.
Undead Authority: Undead enemies serve you temporarily.
Bureaucratic Shield: Damage reduced by paperwork (25%).
King's Court: Summon spectral guards.
Death Tax: Enemies drop extra loot.
James' Blessing: Cannot die; damage delays rather than destroys.

corruptionEffects: The dead begin respecting proper hierarchies.
Contracts and obligations become supernaturally binding.
Time moves like bureaucracy—slowly, with forms.
dialogue: Death was merely a promotion.
The Die-rectors answer to the board. The board answers to me.
Roll. Even kings must acknowledge fate's dice.

pantheon.name: Zero Chance
pantheon.description: Zero Chance appears when probability breaks—when the impossible must happen because nothing else is left. No lucky number because zero is the absence of luck. The event deity who ensures that when all options are exhausted, something happens anyway.

favorEffects.effect: Impossible Save: Survive what should kill you.
Probability Lock: Next roll is guaranteed 6.
Chaos Cascade: All nearby dice reroll randomly.
Zero Point: Reset all cooldowns.
Chance Denial: Enemy abilities fail randomly.
Zero Chance Blessing: Reality bends to accommodate your success.

corruptionEffects: Impossible things happen constantly.
Probability itself becomes corrupted—certain things fail, impossible things succeed.
Die rolls begin showing numbers that shouldn't exist.
dialogue: When all chances are exhausted, I am what remains.
Zero is not nothing. Zero is the space where probability fears to tread.
Roll. Even zero can produce results.

pantheon.name: Alien Baby
pantheon.description: Alien Baby manifests during reality's vulnerable moments, when existence forgets to baby-proof itself. No lucky number—still learning to count past infinity, keeps getting distracted by destroying conceptual mathematics. The apocalypse intern who makes board meetings into playdate chaos.

favorEffects.effect: Reality Bites: Random objects deleted when touched.
Dimensional Drift: Phase between dimensions randomly.
Babble Blast: Your speech damages enemy sanity.
Toddler Rampage: Movement creates reality tears.
Cosmic Calm: Everything frozen except you.
Baby's Joy: Reality becomes playground, all damage becomes hugs.

corruptionEffects: Physics becomes suggestions—gravity throws tantrums.
Time takes naps randomly, freezing everything.
Objects become cosmic teething toys.
dialogue: Goo goo ga VOID!
No meetings! Only play!
Peek-a-boo! Where universe go?

pantheon.name: Alien Old One
pantheon.description: Alien Old One manifests when cosmic horror gets company—two nightmares sharing one body, disagreeing on everything except making reality uncomfortable. No lucky number—can't agree on one, filed formal complaints about each other's suggestions.

favorEffects.effect: Invasion Mode: Enemies become test subjects.
Madness Mode: Reality questions itself.
Chaos Cascade: Physics takes sides randomly.
Therapy Timeout: Everything pauses to process.
Dual Purpose: All items gain second functions.
Unity Terror: Both horrors combine—reality surrenders.

corruptionEffects: Tentacles argue over targets—attacks become unpredictable.
Technology becomes eldritch, magic needs tech support.
Space folds incorrectly as both aspects fight for control.
dialogue: We come in peace—CONQUEST!—PEACE!—CONQUEST!
Resistance is futile—And hilarious—FUTILE!—HILARIOUS!
We are legion—No we're two—LEGION!—TWO!

wanderers.name: Willy One Eye
wanderers.description: Willy One Eye runs the Wandering Market as an interdimensional trading post where impossibilities become inventory. This cyclopean merchant sees profit potential across all timelines through his massive singular eye, transforming reality tears into trade routes.
services: Existential goods: soul crystals, compressed regrets
Dimensional items: reality fragments, temporal shards
Impossible objects: things that shouldn't exist
dialogue: One eye sees more than two ever could.
Welcome to the Wandering Market, where everything's for sale.
Fixed prices are for dimensions with fixed physics.

wanderers.name: Mr. Bones
wanderers.description: Mr. Bones operates as Death's personal accountant, managing supernatural commerce from his mobile office at The Dying Saucer. This skeletal merchant monopolizes death documentation and elemental imports across all domains.
dialogue: Death and taxes are certain. I handle both. Questions?
Your soul has depreciated. Have you considered reinvestment?
Death is just a transition between fiscal years.

wanderers.name: Boo G
wanderers.description: Boo G operates as the afterlife's premier music merchant and spectral MC. This ghostly entrepreneur runs B's Hits from The Dying Saucer, specializing in supernatural sound equipment and ghost-written beats that transcend mortality.
services: Ghost writing: lyrics by actual ghost
dialogue: They said I couldn't drop beats after death. Now I drop beats that make the living drop dead.
Death couldn't stop my flow, just gave it echo.
BOO! That's my name and what I do to crews.

wanderers.name: King James
wanderers.description: King James rules the Null Throne Emporium from his floating throne in Null Providence. This void-touched merchant king specializes in items that exist at the boundary between real and unreal, with probability-based pricing.
services: Void weapons: exist only when observed
dialogue: Every crown is heavier in the void. Every throne floats on nothing.
A crown is just a circle that convinced everyone it matters.
In my kingdom, everyone is equally nothing. Equality at last!

wanderers.name: Dr. Maxwell
wanderers.description: Dr. Maxwell operates The Burning Pages, a mobile bookshop specializing in combustible knowledge and self-destructing literature. This pyromaniac librarian trades dangerous texts that literally burn with truth to customers brave enough to read quickly.
services: Burning books: knowledge with expiration dates
dialogue: Knowledge burns brightest just before it turns to ash.
Speed reading isn't a skill here—it's survival.
Knowledge is power. Power generates heat. Heat causes fire. QED.

wanderers.name: The General
wanderers.description: The General operates Command & Supply as the multiverse's premier military equipment retailer and recruitment center. This skeletal quartermaster runs operations with tactical precision, evaluating every customer for perfect soldier potential while supplying endless wars.
dialogue: Command & Supply isn't just a shop—it's a military operation.
The perfect soldier dies correctly and reports for duty anyway.
Victory is mandatory. Survival is optional. Purchase is recommended.

wanderers.name: Dr. Voss
wanderers.description: Dr. Voss operates the Void Research Lab as both cutting-edge research facility and retail outlet for experimental void technologies. This void-touched scientist turns theoretical research into practical products for customers brave enough to beta-test reality-bending equipment.
services: Beta testing program for new void items
dialogue: The void whispers theorems that mathematics forgot.
Side effects are just undocumented features.
Nothing is unstable, but profitably so.

wanderers.name: X-treme
wanderers.description: X-treme operates X-treme's X-change as a skeletal gambler who bet his flesh and lost spectacularly. This glowing red skeleton transforms every transaction into high-stakes gambling where dice determine all prices.
services: Gambling gear: dice, cards, chance items
dialogue: WELCOME TO X-TREME'S X-CHANGE!
Why pay retail when you can pay RANDOM?
I bet my flesh and lost! Best decision ever!

trophies.name: All-Seeing Eye
trophies.description: Golden prismatic orb grants perfect pattern recognition. Reveals enemy AI patterns as golden trails.
trophies.reward: Enemy AI patterns visible as golden trails, +15% loot drop prediction

trophies.name: Chrono Shard
trophies.description: Vibrating crystal grants temporal displacement. See attack telegraphs from future timeline.
trophies.reward: Dodge rolls phase through time (+3 second window)

trophies.name: Ember Heart
trophies.description: Obsidian heart filled with liquid fire. Continuous flame aura, complete fire immunity.
trophies.reward: Continuous flame aura (10 damage/second), complete fire immunity

trophies.name: Eternal Blade
trophies.description: Handleless blade of pure edge. All attacks ignore armor and shields completely.
trophies.reward: Unique weapon: Blade of Eternity, all attacks ignore armor

trophies.name: Precision Gear
trophies.description: Bronze gear forces frame-perfect precision. Eliminates human error entirely.
trophies.reward: All actions achieve frame-perfect timing automatically

trophies.name: Quantum Metal
trophies.description: Medallion exists in 17 states simultaneously. Quantum tunneling through walls.
trophies.reward: Exist in 17 locations simultaneously, quantum tunneling

trophies.name: Regal Shadow
trophies.description: Living shadow drapes like royal regalia. All NPCs kneel and obey commands.
trophies.reward: All NPCs kneel and obey, shadow acts autonomously

trophies.name: Undying Crown
trophies.description: Bone crown grants instant resurrection. Death becomes minor inconvenience.

trophies.name: Void Fragment
trophies.description: A hole in reality. Phase through all matter, gradual erasure from existence.

trophies.name: Wind Essence
trophies.description: Ethereal essence with negative mass. Permanent levitation, inverted gravity.

factions.name: Void Seekers
factions.motto: Before two, there was one. Before one, there was nothing.
factions.description: Those who seek truth in nothingness. The Void Seekers embrace the philosophy that existence is optional, and true power comes from understanding the baseline of reality itself.
bonuses: +10% dodge chance (reality forgets to hit you)
Void damage ignores 15% of enemy defense
Lucky Number 1 rolls grant brief invulnerability
factions.lore: Founded when The One first spoke the words that questioned existence. Members often debate whether they truly exist or are merely probability manifesting.

factions.name: Iron Collective
factions.motto: Everything can be improved. Everything WILL be improved.
factions.description: Engineers, builders, and those who believe in the power of mechanical perfection. The Iron Collective sees flesh as a prototype and metal as the final form.
bonuses: +20% effectiveness with mechanical weapons
Armor repairs 5% per turn
Lucky Number 2 rolls upgrade a random item temporarily
factions.lore: John's first construction was not a machine, but an ideology. The Collective maintains that all things are simply problems awaiting elegant solutions.

factions.name: Shadow Court
factions.motto: Death is not an ending. It is a promotion.
factions.description: Those who have touched death and returned, or never truly died at all. The Shadow Court understands that mortality is merely a phase, not a destination.
bonuses: +15% lifesteal on all attacks
Revival costs 25% less
Lucky Number 3 rolls summon a shadow ally
factions.lore: Peter established the Court to govern those who exist between life and death. Members often serve as judges in disputes about whether someone is truly gone.

factions.name: Flame Wardens
factions.description: Pyromancers, berserkers, and those who believe destruction is the purest form of creation. The Flame Wardens embrace chaos and the purifying nature of fire.
bonuses: +25% fire damage
Burning enemies take 5% more damage from all sources
Lucky Number 4 rolls trigger a flame burst
factions.lore: Born in the heart of Infernus, the Wardens believe that only through destruction can new things be born. They are surprisingly philosophical for arsonists.

factions.name: Frost Heralds
factions.description: Masters of patience and precision, the Frost Heralds believe in calculated strikes and the wisdom of waiting. They freeze their enemies not just physically, but strategically.
bonuses: +20% ice damage
Slowed enemies have -10% accuracy
Lucky Number 5 rolls freeze an enemy for 1 turn
factions.lore: Alice teaches that heat is impatience made manifest. The Heralds meditate in the coldest reaches of Frost Reach, learning to act only when the moment is perfect.

factions.name: Verdant Order
factions.motto: All things grow. All things return.
factions.description: Druids, healers, and those who honor the cycle of growth and decay. The Verdant Order sees themselves as gardeners of reality, tending to the natural order.
bonuses: +15% healing received
Regenerate 3% HP at the start of each turn
Lucky Number 6 rolls cause overgrowth (area denial)
factions.lore: Jane planted the first seed of the Order in fertile ground, and it has grown ever since. Members believe that even machines will eventually return to nature.

factions.name: The Board Room
factions.motto: All numbers. All doors. All possibilities.
factions.description: An elite faction that transcends the six doors. The Board Room serves all Die-rectors equally and has access to powers from every domain. Membership is by invitation only.
bonuses: Lucky Number 7 counts as any number rolled
+5% to all stats
Can use abilities from any faction once per match
factions.lore: Legend says the Board Room existed before the six doors were numbered. Its members sit at the table where reality itself is decided by dice rolls.

factions.name: Wandering Stars
factions.motto: No master. No door. Only the journey.
factions.description: Those who refuse to pledge allegiance to any Die-rector. The Wandering Stars believe in freedom above all else, traveling between domains without obligation.
bonuses: +10% movement speed
No faction penalties in any domain
Lucky Number 0: Reroll any die once per match
factions.lore: Not every traveler wants a home. The Wandering Stars formed organically from those who found purpose in the journey itself rather than the destination.
